page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This block mainly consists of the village of Cromford and part of Wirksworth, the majority of land being rough pasture. Quarrying, forestry, cattle and sheep grazing and tourism form the major activities. Wirksworth is historically interesting as a centre of lead-mining, Cromford as an early example of a village radically altered by Arkwright's cotton spinning factory. Many relics of its former use attract large numbers of interested visitors. The High Peak Trail, Cromford Canal, the Black Rocks' picnic site, by attracting visitors, help to alleviate pressure on the nearby Peak District National Park. Through this block, the Derwent Valley winds with its superb scenery and natural lines of communication by road, rail, river and canal.
